text: Greg Jones (born 13 January 1996) is an Irish rugby union player, currently playing for Pro14 and European Rugby Champions Cup side Ulster. He plays as a Number 8 or flanker. ==Early life== Born in Sandycove, Dublin, Jones attended St. Andrew's College, and he was part of the Ireland under-20s team that beat New Zealand at the 2016 World Rugby Under 20 Championship. Jones joined the Ulster academy from University College Dublin in the summer of 2017. ==Ulster== Jones made his senior Ulster debut on 24 November 2017 in round 9 of the 2017–18 Pro14, featuring off the bench in the province's 23–22 win against Italian side Benetton. ==References== ==External links== *Ulster Profile *Pro14 Profile Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Rugby union players from County Dublin Category:Irish rugby union players Category:Ulster Rugby players Category:Rugby union number eights
title: Greg Jones (rugby union)
